Summary: ​Interfaces between 1GX and GoA business applications.
Description:
The 1GX Application Programming Interface (API) Service provides Government of Alberta (GoA) business areas with multiple interfaces between 1GX modules and their business applications. It provides them with the ability to search, create, update, and delete records in real time, directly from their business applications, without accessing 1GX directly.

This service must be requested by 1GX ministry service managers, as they are responsible for the integrations between 1GX and ministry applications. They will work with application developers, the 1GX Centre of Excellence (CoE) team, and the Service Integration team to determine which API(s) will meet business area requirements.

The 1GX CoE team approves requests for this service and collaborates with the Service Integration team to collect the requirements needed to configure API Gateway access and security roles
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through BERNIE; search and select the BERNIE service called '1GX API Service'.
Comments: Requests for this service will only be accepted by your ministry's 1GX Service Manager through a BERNIE RITM.

Summary: ​Interfaces between 1GX and GoA business applications using legacy IMAGIS format.
Description: ​Interfaces between 1GX and GoA business applications using iSuite to send/receive files in legacy IMAGIS format. This integration is for legacy GoA applications, it will be phased out and replaced by direct API type of integration with 1GX. ​
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through BERNIE; search and select the BERNIE service called '1GX Legacy IMAGIS Integration Service'
Comments: This integration is for legacy GoA applications, it will be phased out and replaced by direct API type of integration with 1GX. ​

Summary: A deployment of Keycloak, providing user authentication and authorization services.
Description: The Access Service is a deployment of Keycloak, which provides Realms to tenants and serves as the basis for user access management.  As a federated IDP, Keycloak provides user authentication and authorization services, helping you to your tenant secure.  On top of Keycloak, the Access Service provides the user roles necessary to use all other ADSP services.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Summary: Uses incremental "Canada Post" searches to find an address and provide the full address details.
Description: Allows ease of mailing address data entry and validation through 2 endpoints that allow incremental searches to find the correct address and provide the full address details of the selected result.  This service leverages "Canada Post - Address Complete" for it's validation repository.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; click the "Service Request Details" link to access 'Service Integration Consultation Request " web form
Prerequisites: Users will need to submit a Address Validation Service Intake Request to the Service Integration Team via BERNIE "Service Integration Consultation" online form submission to request this service.

Summary: DayJS plugin with information about stat holidays in Alberta
Description: A DayJS plugin for the information about statutory holidays in Alberta
ContactDetails: Privately hosted npm package

Summary: Verify new borns and deceased individuals using Alberta Vital Statistics.
Description: Verify new borns and deceased individuals against the data in Alberta Vital Statistics for a specific Government of Alberta program. This program requires approval from Vital Statistics for data usage, as well as  a privacy assessment.

Summary: An IAM platform that provides federated sign on and identity verification for citizens accessing on-line services
Provides protection, monitoring and performance metrics for APIs. Can act as a firewall, router & DDOS protection for APIs. Also supports advanced features like "custom claims".
Description: Provides protection, monitoring and performance metrics for APIs.  The gateway can act as a firewall, router & DDOS protection for APIs and supports advanced features like "custom claims".  The gateway service is available for both internal/external and on-prem/cloud APIs.  This service leverages the Digital Identiity Gateway for API authentication.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; click the "Service Request Details" link to access 'Service Integration Consultation Request " web form
Prerequisites: Users will need to submit a API gateway as a service Intake Request to the Service Integration Team via BERNIE "Service Integration Consultation" online form submission to request this service.

Summary: A guide for developers & QA testers to get started with QA automation within your application.
Description:
This is QA automation process outlined for service teams. Developers and QA testers should be able to use this as a guide to get started with QA automation within your application.

This documentation will go over all of the QA automation test frameworks in detail, outline the technology stacks used in this process

Summary: Validate financial institution number, branch number, and banking account number format.
Description: Allow applications to validate the financial institution number, branch number, as well as the format of the banking account number.

Summary: Using Amazon QuickSight visualization tool, create interactive dashboards, reports, and embedded analytics with single source of truth + automate Data Pipelines with a shared architecture pattern.
Description:
Justice Digital teams are using Amazon QuickSight as a data visualization tool. With QuickSight, all product teams can meet varying analytic needs from the same source of truth through interactive dashboards, paginated reports, and embedded analytics. 

Product teams are also fully automating their Data Pipelines using a shared architecture pattern.

Summary: Schedule events for end users. Front-end calendar widget (daily, weekly, or monthly). Supports persistent events, managing attendees, event queries, and automatic time-zone conversion.
Description: Provides the capability for scheduling events like meetings, appointments, or similar activities for your application's end users.  ADSP gives you full backend support for creating persistent events, managing attendees, event queries, and automatic time-zone conversion.  It can be used to populate any front-end calendar widget with daily, weekly, or monthly entries.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Description: An Angular library that provides UI components and shared code for Angular apps in Children’s Services, including authentication and authorization through the CCDS Keycloak realm.
ContactDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments: Used within Children's Services to provide consistent UI and tooling for all Angular projects.

Description: A React library that provides UI components and shared code for React apps in Children’s Services, including authentication and authorization through the CCDS Keycloak realm.

Comments: Used within Children's Services to provide consistent UI and tooling for all React projects.

Summary: Validation API for a Alberta government program, child care benefits. Data usage involves a MOU with CRA and Treasury Board and Finance, as well as a privacy assessment.
Description: Assess the eligibility of an Albertan to apply for a Government of Alberta program that necessitates verification of the applicant's child care benefits. The use of data for this assessment requires a MOU with CRA and the Department of Treasury Board and Finance, as well as a privacy assessment.

Summary: An internal API that provides information on all licensed child care providers in Alberta, as well as the staff (Early Childhood Educators) that work there.
ContactDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment
Comments: Used within Children's service to provide data on licensed child care providers.

Summary: Cloud native: build, deploy and manage modern applications in cloud computing environments.
Description: Cloud native is the software approach of building, deploying, and managing modern applications in cloud computing environments. Modern companies want to build highly scalable, flexible, and resilient applications that they can update quickly to meet customer demands.

Description: A common cloud-based API services which enable payment portals with making payments and reconciling payments end-to-end. Payment types are being considered are eTransfer and EFT in bulk.

Summary: Allows optimally storage, cache, and static data usage within your application. Ensuring persistent, schema-compliant, configuration storage.
Description: Use the configuration service to optimally store, and cache, static data used to drive your application.  The service ensures persistent, and schema-compliant, configuration storage using a JSON document store. Write operations will be validated against the schema for accurate and consistent data.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Summary:
Justice staff lookup for metadata, contact information and some court locations.
Justices and Clerks signatures can be applied to documents as required.
Description:
The court personnel API allows Justice Digital service/teams to look up metadata, contact information regarding Justices, Judges, Judicial Assistants, Application Judges and their court locations at any point in the service.

Metadata and contact information for Judges, Justices, Judicial assistants, and Application Judges are collected and updated in a single place.

Signatures of Justices and Clerks are managed within the Shared Service and through secure access, can be applied to documents as required.

 The shared service serves as the source of truth for this information, where delegated authorities from the courts update information for all other services and systems to pull from.

Summary: A data governance plan outlining processes and procedures to ensure data quality, security, and privacy across all shared services of the Justice Digital Services Platform.
Description: The Data Governance Plan outlines the processes and procedures to ensure data quality, security, and privacy across all shared services of the Justice Digital Services Platform. It comprises a set of standard operating procedures (SOPs) aimed at promoting consistency, reliability, and compliance in the handling, management, and modification of shared services.

Summary: A design system for designers and developers to create consistent and cohesive user experiences across multiple products and platforms.
Description: The Design System team is responsible for creating and maintaining the assets used for building DDD product layouts, interactions, and patterns. The design system is a shared language for designers and developers to create consistent and cohesive user experiences across multiple products and platforms.
Language: Web components, Design tokens, Angular, React
Version: Web components 1.14.0 , Design tokens 1.1.1 , Angular components 2.5.0 , React components 4.14.0
UseCases: A design system is a centralized resource that provides guidelines, assets, and code to help teams build digital products. It helps maintain consistency across multiple projects and allows teams to focus on higher-level tasks rather than reinventing low-level elements.
Comments: Include the design system in all DDD products; it should act as the foundation for developing the front-end of any government service.

Summary: Provides a central register of service APIs
Description: As a central register of APIs, the Directory Service gives you a means for service discovery.  They can use the Directory Service to find service URLs and decouple application code from changes in the URL due to, for example, a newer version, or a change in the application's environment.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Summary: Document manipulation such as: Mail Merges, PDF Form Filling and PDF Redaction. Supports formats such as .docx, .xlsx, pdf, etc.
Description: Provides a number of document manipulation features including:  Mail Merges, PDF Form Filling and PDF Redaction.  This service supports a number of input and output formats (.docx, .xlsx, pdf, etc.)  -->  Enhancement requests can be made for additional features
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; click the "Requesting a Service" link to access 'Service Integration Consultation Request " web form
Prerequisites: Users will need to submit a Document service Intake Request to the Service Integration Team via BERNIE "Service Integration Consultation" online form submission to request this service.

Summary: Allows basic file management of project-specific content within ECM systems (e.g., file creation, modification, metadata, etc.) for OpenText.
Description:
The Electronic Content Management (ECM) Connector is a representational state transfer (REST) application programming interface (API) that allows file management of Government of Alberta (GoA) content within ECM systems (e.g. file creation, modification, metadata, etc.).

The ECM Connector takes REST calls and translates them into a format that is understood by the proprietary Open Text LIVELINK web services (LAPI) running on the GoA’s OpenText Enterprise Content Servers (ECSS) server.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through BERNIE; search and select the BERNIE service called 'Electronic Content Management (ECM) Connector'

Summary: Allows the user to access the platform to create and send envelopes, monitor and administer user activity and manage other aspects of the e-signature business process and workflow.
Description:
The eSignature is a cloud-based service that allows subscribers to prepare and send documents for electronic signatures.  With this service, subscribers can send contracts and agreements to both GoA internal and external clients for signatures and approvals.  The service is secure, cost-effective, timesaving, user-friendly, and compliant with GoA guidelines and standards.  The signed documents are protected, and the signers are uniquely identified by using multiple authentication methods.

The following tasks can be performed using this request:

Request a consultation with the eSignature support team
Subscribe to the eSignature service
Add, change, and remove users from your eSignature service subscription
Assign signature projects to users
Cancel the eSignature service subscription
You are encouraged to request a consultation to learn more about the service before subscribing to the service.  During the consultation meeting, you are provided with the service features, costs, and details on the subscription process.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through BERNIE; search and sekect the BERNIE service called "eSignature Service".

Summary: A powerful email service with similar or more capabilities than your outlook client.
Description: Sends emails to one or many recipients with multiple parameters: To, CC and BCC, ability to specify a FROM recipient, supply a subject line, options for the message body such as HTML, Rich Text or Plain Text, and the sender can attach one or more attachments to the ​email.  Provides similar formatting capabilities as your outlook client.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; click the "Request the service" link and access the 'Service Integration Intake Request' web form

Summary: An API proxy that consumes Government of Canada employment API endpoints and handles security and API aggregation.
ContactDetails: Discussion required to obtain access or to deploy container in line of business controlled environment

Summary: Provides capability for applications to define, and log, domain events giving an easy implement traceability, auditability, accountability and transparency.  Often coupled with other ADSP services.
Description: The event service provides the capability for applications to define, and log, domain events.  This gives them an easy way to implement traceability, auditability, accountability and transparency.  In addition the service is often coupled, and used in conjunction with, other ADSP services. E.G an application is using the Notification Service it would use specific domain events to trigger notifications.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Summary: Provides capabilities for uploading and managing files in Microsoft's Azure Blob Storage.  Includes support for virus scanning, access control, retention policy, retrieval, and searching.
Description: Provides capabilities for uploading and managing files in Microsoft's Azure Blob Storage.  It includes support for virus scanning, access control, retention policy, retrieval, and searching. The service is intended to give applications a means to manage temporary files (e.g. retention policy < 30 days), or whose content is not directly needed by the application's business users.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Data can be entered and modified over multiple sessions; users are sent a verification code each time they wish to revisit the submission.

This will help reduce disruptions in access to Justice Digital services and enable external users such as lawyers to use multiple Justice Digital services with a single account, making access more streamlined.

Summary: Enable text or email notifications in your application.  Build customizable templates to send automated personalized messages, such as needing approval, or action reminders.
Description: Enable text or email notifications in your application through the ADSP Notification Service.  Build customizable templates and use these to send personalized messages to your users upon the occurrence of specific "domain events" in your application, such as receiving approval for a submission, or reminders to take some action.

Summary: Provides a message bus interface to AB Notify
Notes on OAuth for Browser-Based Apps
Description: This specification details the threats, attack consequences, security considerations and best practices that must be taken into account when developing browser-based applications that use OAuth 2.0.
Documentation:
https://goa-dio.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/WDS/pages/2758869310/Admin+RestAPI+request+flow

Pattern to implement OAuth BFF Proxy flow https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-oauth-browser-based-apps#name-backend-for-frontend-bff-pr
Prerequisites: The implementation is using BFF Duende framework, license might be required

Summary: A common e-payment service that offers a centralized electronic payment experience.   This service leverage the GoA TD Beanstream platform.
Description:
The Payment Gateway Service (PGS) offers a centralized electronic payment experience with the GoA using the TD Online Mart online payments solution. This standardized approach has many advantages over direct integration with current payment providers, such as:  

Application insulation from organizational change. When the payment provider changes, the application code does not. Consequently, PGS can seamlessly manage a new payment provider without manual intervention. 
Business areas no longer have to complete the Payment Card Industry Self-Assessment Questionnaire (PCI SAQ) A type audits.
ContactDetails: Advanced request required through the Service Integration SharePoint site; click the "Request Payment Gateway Service" link to access the 'Service Integration Consultation Request " web form
Prerequisites: Business area will require a merchant account for their transactions.  This can be obtained through TBF merchant services (the process to obtain a merchant account is documented as part of the onboarding procedures)

Summary: TD Bambora is the recommended payment solution for service teams within Justice Digital.
Justice Digital services use consistent architecture to facilitate PDF generation and merging functionality.
Creates customized GOA branded PDF documents for end users. Securely managed using Azure storage.
Description: Provides the capability for creating customized PDF documents for downloading by end users. By utilizing our editor to create templates and combining them with intake data, developers can easily create GOA branded PDFs.  The documents are uploaded to Azure Blob storage and can be managed there securely, throughout their lifecycle, with the ADSP file service.
Prerequisites: Product teams can get started by accessing an existing tenant or creating a new tenant. Each tenant represents a zone of administrative control and generally products within a common service area can share a tenant.

Allows the user to create digital signatures in a form of QR (Quick Response) Code images which can then be verified by using this application or the third party solutions, like mobile or desktop custom applications.​

This is particularly useful for calculations that are changed frequently, or for multi-tenant applications that handle calculations on a per-tenant basis.

A web-based software platform using real-time processing and provides the Government of Alberta (GoA) business areas with 5 main functions:  collect and index, search and investigate, add knowledge, report, and visualize, monitor and alert, on machine data, websites, applications, within the GoA infrastructure.

Summary: Monitoring the health of applications and services.
Description: A service for monitoring the health of applications and other services.  You provide a URL for it to ping and it will notify you, or a webhook, if the response occurs in a timely manner or not.  Additionally, the service provides links to a static web page your users can visit to check on your application's status.  You can configure this page to display status updates and notices for planned maintenance or other outages.

As our services evolve and our user base continues to expand, an integrated support model will allow JD to continue to improve its service delivery capabilities.

Summary: Provides a temporal-based data store useful for storing such things as event, change, and audit logs.  In addition, it can aggregate KPIs.
Description: Provides a temporal-based data store that is useful for storing such things as event, change, and audit logs.  In addition, it can be used to aggregate KPI's over some time interval by including metrics along with each entry.  For example, it has been used to log events along with a count metric, and therefore can be used to show how many events are emitted per unit of time.
